name: Dijon Cream Sauce
instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly to form a roux.
Slowly whisk in the milk or half-and-half to avoid lumps.
Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 5–6 minutes.
Stir in the Dijon mustard, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm over Chicken Cordon Bleu or other proteins.

storage_tips.refrigeration: Store cooled sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat gently on the stovetop, whisking to restore texture.
storage_tips.freezing: Not recommended—sauce may separate when thawed.
storage_tips.make_ahead: Sauce can be made earlier the same day and reheated just before serving.
